Sentence.sentence: A tax on upstream carbon sources is one easy way to put a price on carbon emissions, although some countries may wish to use other methods, such as emissions trading schemes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: You need to understand as a citizen and as a tax payer and as a voter what’s really behind the arguments.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: With a tax imposed on expensive health insurance plans, most employers will likely transfer money from health expenses into wages.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The Senate Finance bill would impose an excise tax ( ' ,  消费税) on health insurance plans that cost more than $8,000 for an individual or $21,000 for a family.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The House bill has no similar tax.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: That is far less likely to happen if Congress also adopts strong pay-go rules requiring that any increase in payments to providers be offset by new taxes or budget cuts.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Present budget policies tax parents heavily to support the elderly.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Meanwhile, tax breaks for children are modest
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: To appeal for tax reduction for raising children.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A simple consumption tax of, say, 5% would significantly reduce the country's huge government deficit without damaging productivity.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A small gasoline tax would help free America from its dependence on oil imports and create incentives for green energy development
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: By far the most effective method to restrain pension spending is to give people the opportunity to work longer, because it increases tax revenues and reduces spending on pensions at the same time.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Many developing countries have lots of young people in need of jobs; many rich countries need helping hands that will boost tax revenues and keep up economic growth
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: This generated little commerce for downtown businesses in the evenings, which made business and generating tax revenue for municipal upkeep difficult.
Sentence.come: 2017年12月六级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: You need to understand as a citizen and as a tax payer and as a voter what's really behind the arguments.
Sentence.come: 2017年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section C

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"征税"之意。
means: tax ： 普通用词，指用各种不同方法向个人或单位征收所得税、房地产税等各种税款。侧重实际征收金钱。
impose ： 指在决定个别案件中的处罚或罚款，尤指政府征收某种税收的决定。
assess ： 指一般情况下，征收房地产税、罚款或其它费用。

Sentence.sentence: From the governments' point of view, a primary goal of laws requiring extended producer responsibility is to transfer both the cost and the physical responsibility of waste management from the government and tax-payers back to the producers.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: They should pay some sort of tax and be fined for not wearing them.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: When he reads of the threatening foreign situation, the mounting national debt, rising taxes, falling market, scarce housing, and cancer.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 任务型阅读 原文

Sentence.sentence: Stemming climate change, for example, is as much about changing consumption patterns and promoting tax acceptance as it is about developing clean energy.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Taxes on low-wage labor need to be cut, and wage subsidies such as the earned income tax credit should be expanded: This would boost incomes, encourage work, reward companies for job creation, and reduce inequality.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Finally,because automation threatens to widen the gap between capital income and labor income, taxes and the safety net will have to be rethought.
Sentence.come: 出自-2018年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Amazon.com, with its network of warehouses, also collects sales tax in every state that charges it, though third-party sellers who use the site don't have to.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Big chains have been collecting sales tax nationwide because they typically have physical stores in whatever state a purchase is being shipped to.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Both France and the United States are involved in the organization's work, but France's digital services tax and the American response raise questions about what the future holds for the international tax system.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: But it has already sparked significant controversy, with the Unite Sates trade representative opening an investigation into whether the tax discriminates against American companies, which in turn could lead to trade sanctions against France.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Customers were generally responsible for paying the sales tax to the state themselves if they weren't charged it, but most didn't realize they owed it and few paid.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Digital services include everything from providing a platform for selling goods and services online to targeting advertising based on user data, and the tax applies to gross revenue from such services.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: France's planned tax is a clear warning: Unless a broad consensus can be reached on reforming the international tax system, other nations are likely to follow suit, and American companies will face a cascade of different taxes from dozens of nations that
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In other words, they all share a view that the international tax system has failed to keep up with the current economy.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Instead, the digital services tax is part of a much larger trend, with countries over the past few years proposing or putting in place an alphabet soup of new international tax provisions.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Last Thursday, the French Senate passed a digital services tax, which would impose an entirely new tax on large multinationals that provide digital services to consumers or users in France.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Many French politicians and media outlets have referred to this as a "GAFA tax," meaning that it is designed to apply primarily to companies such as Google, Apple, Facebook and Amazon—in other words, multinational tech companies based in the United States
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Much more could be done to encourage "long-termism", such as changes in the tax code and quicker disclosure of stock acquisitions.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Not everyone will agree with the authors'policy ideas, which range from mandating more holiday time to reducing tax incentives for American home buyers.
Sentence.come: 2014年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Now, rivals will be charging sales tax where they hadn't before.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Sellers that use eBay and Etsy, which provide platforms for smaller sellers, also haven't been collecting sales tax nationwide.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: States will be able to force more people to pay sales tax when they make online purchases under a Supreme Court decision Thursday that will leave shoppers with lighter wallets but is a big financial win for states.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: The cases the court overturned said that if a business was shipping a customer's purchase to a state where the business didn't have a physical presence such as a warehouse or office, the business didn't have to collect sales tax for the state.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: The decisions made it more difficult for states to collect sales tax on certain online purchases.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: The digital services tax now awaits the signature of President Emmanuel Macron, who has expressed support for the measure, and it could go into effect within the next few weeks.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The French tax is not just a unilateral move by one country in need of revenue.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The ruling is a victory for big chains with a presence in many states, since they usually collect sales tax on online purchases already.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: These have included Britain's DPT diverted profits tax, Australia's MAAL multinational anti-avoidance law, and India's SEP significant economic presence test, to name but a few.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: These unilateral developments differ in their specifics, but they are all designed to tax multinationals on income and revenue that countries believe they should have a right to tax, even if international tax rules do not grant them that right.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: This might mean implementing policy such as a plastic tax that adds a cost to environmentally problematic action, or banning single-use plastics altogether.
Sentence.come: 2019年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Those retailers may face headaches complying with various state sales tax laws.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: Though often viewed as a problem for western states, the growing frequency of wildfires is a national concern because of impact on federal tax dollars, says Professor Max Moritz, a specialist in fire ecology and management.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Under the ruling Thursday, states can pass laws requiring out-of-state sellers to collect the state's sales tax from customers and send it to the state.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

sentences.en: Governments don't tax children.
sentences.cn: 政府不向孩子们征税。

sentences.en: Reading in a poor light taxes the eyes.
sentences.cn: 在暗淡的光线下看书很累眼睛。

means.word_mean: 使负重担；使受压力；使大伤脑筋

sentences.en: People who refuse to pay tax can be put in prison.
sentences.cn: 拒绝纳税的人会被送进监狱。</seg>

sentence.cn: 当他读到国外形势的威胁，不断增加的国家债务，不断增加的税收，不断下降的市场，稀缺的住房和癌症。
sentence.en: When he reads of the threatening foreign situation, the mounting national debt, rising taxes, falling market, scarce housing, and cancer.
sentence.from: 2015年高考英语江苏卷 任务型阅读 原文

entry.def: Tax is an amount of money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for public services.

example.ex: They are calling for large spending cuts and tax increases.
example.tran: 他们呼吁大幅度削减开支并提高税收。

entry.def: When a person or company is taxed, they have to pay a part of their income or profits to the government. When goods are taxed, a percentage of their price has to be paid to the government.

example.ex: Husband and wife are now taxed separately on their incomes...
example.tran: 现在夫妻双方分别按各自的收入纳税。

example.ex: ...the government's commitment to simplifying the way companies are taxed...
example.tran: 政府简化公司纳税手续的承诺

entry.def: If something taxes your strength, your patience, or your resources, it uses nearly all of them, so that you have great difficulty in carrying out what you are trying to do.
entry.tran: 使用尽，耗尽(力气、耐心、资源等)

example.ex: Overcrowding has taxed the city's ability to deal with waste...
example.tran: 人口过多使得城市的垃圾处理能力达到了极限。

example.ex: These dilemmas would tax the best of statesmen.
example.tran: 这些进退两难的局面对一流的政治家也是个考验。

means.word_mean: 1. charge against a citizen's person or property or activity for the support of government

sentences.sentence: "Clothing is not taxed in our state"

means.word_mean: 2. set or determine the amount of (a payment such as a fine)
4. make a charge against or accuse;

sentences.sentence: "They taxed him failure to appear in court"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'estimate or determine the amount of a penalty or damages', surviving in sense 3): from Old French taxer, from Latin taxare 'to censure, charge, compute', perhaps from Greek tassein 'fix'

sentences.cn: 许多低收入者已被完全免除了所得税的负担.
sentences.en: Many people with small incomes have been relieved of income tax altogether.

sentences.cn: 除上述的税务和关税外,其他的税务和关税, 如果有, 应有买方负担.
sentences.en: Any tax or duty other than those described hereinabove, if any, be borne by the Buyer.

sentences.cn: 照料六个孩子成了她精力上很大的负担.
sentences.en: The care of six children was a tax on her energies.

sentences.cn: 现行的税收制度是不公平的, 因为它给中资企业强加了很重的负担.
sentences.en: The current tax system, which imposes a higher burden on domestic companies, is unfair.

sentences.cn: 个人将购买超过2年的普通住房对外销售的, 不负担营业税.
sentences.en: Individual will purchase surpasses 2 year ordinary housing foreign sale, does not bear the business tax.

sentences.cn: 那工作对他的心脏是沈重的负担.
sentences.en: The work was a tax on his heart.

sentences.cn: 而他们的想法丝毫不能减轻令人窒息的官僚作风以及税收负担.
sentences.en: Neither cut the country's suffocating bureaucracy and tax burden.

sentences.cn: 一种选择就是把粮食补贴负担转移到普通纳税人身上.
sentences.en: An alternative is to shift the burden of food subsidies to the general tax payer.

sentences.cn: 第四 、 加强购销管理, 逐步转移退税负担成本.
sentences.en: Fourth, the strengthening of purchases and sales management, the burden of tax rebate gradually transfer costs.

sentences.cn: 最好的税应该产生最小的额外负担.
sentences.en: The best tax would be one that generates the least excess burden.

sentences.cn: 税收通常会造成超额负担—超过所征收上来的税收收入的一种成本.
sentences.en: Taxes generally impose an excess burden – a cost beyond the tax revenue collected.

sentences.cn: 有些人居住在国外,为的是摆脱沉重的捐税负担.
sentences.en: Some people live abroad to get out of paying heavy taxes.

sentences.cn: 更多税收和政府成平加重港人负担.
sentences.en: More tax and cost burden add to HK people.

sentences.cn: 那儿的地方政府使人民负担沉重的捐税和债务.
sentences.en: The local government there burdened the people with heavy taxes and debts.

sentences.cn: 他曾小心地试图减轻匈牙利巨大的税收负担,但是收效甚微.
sentences.en: His timid attempts to cut Hungary's stifling tax burden have had little impact.

sentences.cn: 因此,对亚洲投资者来说,他们在所居地缴税,是投资于这类基金的唯一税务负担.
sentences.en: Funds organised in both places have virtually no tax liability on the arisingon capital gains achieved.

sentences.cn: 与其它形式的工商企业相比, 从税收负担方面看,个体制工商企业业主是最为幸运的.
sentences.en: Compared with other forms of business, sole proprietors are luckiest businessmen in terms of tax burden.

sentences.cn: 企业有权利要求减轻企业所得税的负担.
sentences.en: The company claims tax relief against their corporation tax.

sentences.cn: 农业税取消了, 还有农民负担 吗 ?
sentences.en: Agriculture Tax Cancelled , Peasants Burden Existing?

sentences.cn: 政府使国民负担重税.
sentences.en: The government burdened the nation with heavy taxes.

sentences.cn: 他希望将某些税收负担由员工转移给消费者和富人.
sentences.en: He wants to shift some the tax burden from employers to consumers and the rich.

sentences.cn: 这使它们背负了更沉重的税务负担,并容易因会计问题而遭到指控.
sentences.en: This imposes a heavier tax burden on and makes them vulnerable to accusations on accounting errors.

Sentence.sentence: With surging obesity levels putting increasing strain on public health systems, governments around the world have begun to toy with the idea of taxing sugar as well.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Whether such taxes work is a matter of debate.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Two and a half centuries on, most countries impose some sort of tax on alcohol and tobacco.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The practice of taxing alcohol and tobacco has proved both popular and profitable.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: By contrast, a Danish tax on foods high in fats was abandoned a year after its introduction, amid claims that consumers were avoiding it by crossing the border to Germany to satisfy their desire for cheaper, fattier fare.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: And a number of oil-producing countries are trimming their gasoline subsidies and raising taxes, so the net savings for global consumers is not as big as the oil price plunge might suggest.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A preliminary review of Mexico's taxation found a fall in purchases of taxed drinks as well as a rise in sales of untaxed and healthier drinks.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: We pay for these services through taxes.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Tax breaks bring the cost down, especially in California, but in many states ZEHs can be prohibitively expensive.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: gives the owner substantial tax benefits
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The other measures include restricting portion sizes, taxing and prohibiting special price deals for junk foods, and placing warning labels on the products.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: "The tax passed today unfairly singles out beverages—including low- and no-calorie choices," said Lauren Kane, spokeswoman for the American Beverage Association.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Public health groups applauded the approved tax as a step toward fixing certain lasting health issues that plague Americans.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: So we will side with the majority of the people of Philadelphia who oppose this tax and take legal action to stop it.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The fifth largest city in US passed a significant soda tax proposal that will levy 1.5 cents per liquid ounce on distributors.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: The tax will apply to regulaR&Diet sodas, as well as other drinks with added sugar, such as Gatorade and iced teas.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: Until now, the only city to successfully pass and implement a soda tax was Berkeley, California, in 2014.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C

Sentence.sentence: While the city council vote was met with applause inside the council room, opponents to the measure, including soda lobbyists made sharp criticisms and a promise to challenge the tax in court.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第一套）阅读 Section C
